utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, want to spend some time playing the new Star Wars game this weekend?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. I kind of promised myself I’d get off the computer, be more physically active. Get some exercise.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re about to walk up three flights of stairs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good point, I’m in.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know what would be great? Let’s do it like the old days.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You mean, are you talking gaming marathon?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. Start Saturday morning, go 48 hours, sleeping bags, junk food.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Turn off our phones so our moms can’t call.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It would be like our World Of Warcraft a few years ago when the neighbours called the cops on us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They called the cops because of the smell. They thought we were dead.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We were badass back in the day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, let’s do it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: 48 hours of Star Wars gaming.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s on like Alderaan.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, clear your weekend. Starting Saturday morning, Star Wars marathon

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Woo-hoo!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Movies or video games? Or board game? Or trading card games? Or Lego’s? Or dress up? Or comic books? Or dramatic readings of novelizations? Yes to all!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We are going to play the online game.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The online game? Bully!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Gentlemen, as much as I’m sure Sheldon would enjoy playing intergalactic make-believe, he and I have other plans. We are attending my Aunt Flora’s 93rd birthday party.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Just tell her I can’t come.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She’ll be disappointed if we don’t show up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s 93. She won’t be disappointed for very long.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, hang on. I followed all the protocols set forth by you in the relationship agreement. I made a written record request 72 hours in advance. I checked the tyre pressure on the car. I even contacted the Centres For Disease Control to find out what shots they recommend for travel to Orange County. FYI, it’s none.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, the relationship agreement was not designed for either one of us to get our way.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You use it to get your way.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I use it to get the right way. The fact that the right way is also my way is a happy coincidence.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You gave me your word. You’re coming with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’ll miss you, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, who wants to spend the whole weekend, running around a bunch of pretend planets battling made up monsters. That’s for babies.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s got lightsabres.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, please, Amy! It’s got lightsabres!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey Sheldon. Help you with anything?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I’m attending a party this weekend, for a 93-year-old woman. Can you recommend a gift?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, I don’t know. Could put a tennis ball on the end of Excalibur. Make a pretty badass cane.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you supply the the tennis ball?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then no. What else?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hmm. Oh, have this collectors edition Batman utility belt. Maybe she can use it as a wearable pill caddy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, she’d just look silly wearing that without the rest of the costume.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I’m sorry Sheldon, that’s it. That’s all I got.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, it’s not your fault. I’ve been to the model train store. I’ve been to Radio Shack. This woman is impossible to shop for.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’d make fun of Sheldon for having girl problems if I wasn’t in shock that Sheldon has girl problems.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, Leonard, go ahead and mock. Like my daddy always said, Shelly, women aren’t anything but flippin’ pains in the bottom.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s what your father used to say?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I took out the bad words and the yeehaw, but you get the gist.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, if you don’t want to go to the party, just don’t go. You’re a grown man. Act like one. Tell Amy you want to spend the weekend having a sleepover and playing video games with your friends. Maybe she’ll dig it. Women like a firm hand on the tiller.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can never find the tiller. I got a book; it didn’t help.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I always thought if I were ever enslaved, it would be by an advanced species from another planet, not some hotsy-totsy from Glendale.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Now, I downloaded an app that might be helpful in this situation.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re right. I’m smart as a whip. I should be able to figure this out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, listen, I kind of made plans with the guys this weekend, but then I wondered, because we’re in this relationship-beta-test, if I should have asked you first. Then I thought if I did check with you first, you’d think that I was taking things to seriously. And then, then I got a nosebleed.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You don’t have to check with me. Do whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. I guess I was hoping for a different reaction, but okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really, what were you hoping for?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, maybe that you’d be a little upset, and then you’d realize that I’m a stallion that has to run free. And that would turn you on a little.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’m an actress. Ask me again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you mind if I spend the weekend playing video games with the guys?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Whu… the entire weekend? You mean I wouldn’t see you at all? But I ju… No, no, I knew what I was getting into. You can’t put a saddle on Leonard Hofstadter. Oh, my, is it getting hot in here? Ay, papi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ay papi? What is that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: An acting choice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. So you chose that when you become turned on, you turn into Speedy Gonzalez?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Choo got a problem with that, papi?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh-uh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny! Penny! Penny!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry, Stallion. Your weird friend Giraffe is here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, Penny. I just stopped by to bring you this gift.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Gummy bears? Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now that you’re in my debt, please manipulate Amy into releasing me from my commitment to attend her aunt’s tedious birthday party.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not a chance.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. I thought the candy might not be enough so let me up the ante. These are Cooper Coupons. These are for various things I can do for you. Um, oh, this one is for one free grammar check. Uh, you could use it for emails, letters, tattoos, what have you. Um, oh, this is fun one. This is an afternoon with me at the California Science Center, where I point out their mistakes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Keep an eye on those expiration dates, I’ve been burned more than once.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, sweetie, I’m not going to get involved in your relationship.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, come on. It’s just a simple favour. Now, when’s the last time I asked you to do something for me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yesterday. You made me look in your ear to see if there was a ladybug in it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When is the last time I asked you to do something that wasn’t a medical emergency?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yesterday. You made me look in your ear to see if there was a ladybug in it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, then, I have no choice but to go on to plan B.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m going to run around outside with a wet head and try to catch a cold.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think you’re really going to enjoy yourself today. Not only do you get to meet my relatives, but since my aunt’s nursing home is catering the party, all of the food is incredibly soft. It’s like a vacation for your teeth.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You sure you’re okay with this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I decided to find a way that I could have this experience and enjoy it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you. That means a lot to me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, don’t thank me. Thank wireless technology. I realized, I can go to your aunt’s awful party and still spend the whole day gaming with my friends.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, my relatives are going to want to talk to you, and you’re going to be sitting there playing a game? Isn’t that a little rude?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I got that covered. Headset. I won’t hear a word the old geezers are saying.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, if playing that game is more important to you than honouring your commitment to me, and you don’t mind me showing up at a party all by myself after I’ve already told everybody I’ll be bringing somebody, then, fine. Go home and play your game.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thanks. Ooh, listen, I wouldn’t mind a piece of birthday cake, provided the old gal’s candle blow is clean and dry.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Here you go. I’ve got everything we’ll need for the big game. Low fat turkey jerky, low-carb beer, 100-calorie snack packs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You pick up a Y chromosome while you were there? You might be short one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, I plan on levelling up in the game, not my swimsuit size, thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, the game offers us a choice between playing for the Republic and the light side, or the Sith Empire and the dark side.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, we’re always the good guys. In D_D, we’re lawful good, in City Of Heroes, we’re the heroes, in Grand Theft Auto, we pay the prostitutes promptly and never hit them with a bat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Those women are prostitutes? You said they were raising money for stem cell research.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, guys, I got a surprise.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, if it’s yoghurt that helps ladies poop, I think Raj beat you to it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. Bernadette’s going to be playing with us. So, that’s pretty cool, huh? Right? Sure it is, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What, you invited your girlfriend? This is supposed to be our weekend.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I had no choice. Last night, she said, why don’t we go out for brunch tomorrow and then maybe the Arboretum. And I said, well, no, I promised the guys I was going to play a video game with them all weekend. And she said, that sounds like fun, can I come, too? And then I didn’t answer for a second, and then she said, well, do you not want me to come? And then I bought her a new laptop and the game, and she’s parking the car right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is the whip sound app contextually appropriate here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, it is, but I think you might’ve waited too long for it to be funny. I was wrong, it’s still funny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good. Hah-hah!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Amy, what’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: My boyfriend’s a jerk.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I know he didn’t cheat on you, so what happened?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I had to go to my aunt’s party all by myself, and everybody was like, where’s this boyfriend you’re always talking about? Is he real, or did you make him up like Armin the miniature horse breeder?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Who’s Armin the miniature horse breeder?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: The pretend boyfriend I invented to get my family off my back. It unravelled quickly when I couldn’t answer the question how’d you two meet?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I would have thought at a miniature horse show.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, that’s good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I panicked and said Woodstock. I just wanted to show Sheldon off to my family.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure, I get that. I mean, he’s your first boyfriend and all.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Not just my first boyfriend, he’s the best boyfriend. I mean, think about it. I’m dating Sheldon Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes. On purpose.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: He’s handsome, he’s lanky, he’s brilliant, and his skin has that pale, waxy quality.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, sickly is the new sexy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm. You know, Amy, sometimes when you’re in a relationship with someone you really care about, the sucky part is, it leaves you open to getting hurt.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you ever worry about Leonard doing that to you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s hilarious. No.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Get that guy! Get that guy! Pew! Pew! Pew! Pew!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dr. Rostenkowski, it may interest you to know that saying pew, pew, pew isn’t as effective as pressing your blaster key. In the same way that saying whee doesn’t make the land speeder go.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Pew!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Raj, Imperial Troopers on your tail.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Got him. When Gandhi advocated his philosophy of non-violence, I bet he didn’t know how much fun it was killing stuff.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, I think we got them all. Let’s divide up the loot.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Ooh, look at this pretty purple robe I just got. You should put on yours and then we’ll match.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But I worked hard to get this armour.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sorry, I just thought it’d be nice if people knew we were a couple.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll change.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hah-hah!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t think I want to play a game.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on. They’re playing one across the hall, we should, too. Okay, we are gonna take turns bouncing a quarter off the table, and if it goes into this cup, the other person has to drink. Then you get to go again…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Like that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow. Yeah, b-beginner’s luck. So, now I will drink this entire cup of beer, and you will go again and we can… uh… all right. So, yeah, okay, now I’m gonna drink this entire cup and then I’m going to drink another one… Okay, seriously, stop. What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Spent a lot of my childhood throwing coins into wishing wells hoping for friends. At a certain point, you start doing trick shots just to keep things interesting.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, give me a second to catch up here. Hold on.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’d be my boyfriend. Happier playing his dopey Star Trek game with his friends than hanging out with me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wars.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Star Wars. They get all cranky when you mix the two up.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s the difference?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: There’s absolutely no difference.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How do I get him to treat me better?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. Let me give you a little girlfriend 101. Usually the first move out of the gate is you withhold sex, but that will work better after Sheldon hits puberty. So, I’d say give him the silent treatment.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, he loves that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Our record for sitting in a room together and not speaking to each other is six-and-a half hours. He said it was a magical evening.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, then we’re gonna have to go with an oldie but goodie, making a scene.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t think I’d be good at that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s why you’re lucky to have me. Back in Omaha, there are two different restaurants I’m not allowed into. Both Chili’s.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Bernadette, remember, your character’s the healer in our group. You’re in charge of healing all of us, not just Howard.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I can’t help it. My Howie Wowie has an owie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is the most sickeningly sweet thing I have ever experienced. And I am sipping Kool-Aid through a Red Vine.

utterance.speaker: Amy (bursting in)
utterance.content: Sheldon Cooper, I’ve got a bone to pick with you, and I’m about to do it in front of all your friends.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you pick that bone. You pick that bone clean!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m gonna publicly shame you, and then sit back as societal pressure compels you to modify your behaviour.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, burn!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And if you don’t start treating me better, I’m leaving you for a miniature horse breeder named Armin.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Armin who?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Armin… damn it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, she wanted to show you off to her family, and you stood her up, okay? Look at this adorable, smushy face. Smush, smush, smush, smush.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re hurting me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, Sheldon hurt you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Before; now it’s you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think I understand. You’re the one person who can say Sheldon Cooper is your boyfriend, but that rings hollow if you can’t lord him over others in the flesh. I forget what I bring to the party and what I take away when I leave. Please accept these valuable Cooper Coupons as restitution.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, she doesn’t want your stupid…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ooh, Science Center. Redeeming. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well played, Amy Farrah Fowler. Let me get my coat. Oh, grow up, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But e-excuse me, I have something to say. None of you may realize it, but I was very much looking forward to this weekend. It was gonna be like the old days, the four of us hanging out playing video games before you guys all got girlfriends. Do you have any idea what it’s like to be the only one without a girlfriend? Even if I get one someday, I’ll still be the guy who got a girl after Sheldon Cooper!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And that’s how a girl makes a scene. I’m sorry, sweetie. You’re right. You deserve your weekend. Come on, Amy, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What about the Science Center?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’ll let you hold my hair while I throw up.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Rain check.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m gonna go, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll miss you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’ll miss you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll miss you more.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, I’ll…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Just leave! Okay, now. This is the way it’s supposed to be. Men together, fighting the forces of evil.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hear! Hear!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can’t believe this is only 64 calories.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard Joel Wolowitz! I’ve been worried sick for two days, and I know you turned off your phone! You open up this door right now because I’ve had it up to here! I have been to the morgue and the hospital, and I spent the last half hour walking up these ferkakta stairs!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s my ride, got to go.
